intro: Onosma pabotii, commonly known as the Persian skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of Iran and Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinct appearance. Onosma pabotii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
